data.author: Lee Chong Ming
data.title: AI is triggering a quiet hiring comeback for some entry-level talent, say public company CEOs
data.description: A new survey shows CEOs expect AI to boost hiring in 2026, especially for entry-level roles.
data.content:
CEOs say AI will drive more hiring next year, with entry-level and technical roles set to grow, according to a new global survey.Nitat Termmee/Getty Images

data.author: Bloomberg
data.title: Global funds view Indian stocks as a top hedge against AI risks
data.description: With the AI frenzy fading and India’s stock valuations falling back near their five-year average after sharply trailing peers this year, the consumption-driven economy is back in favor
data.content:
India is drawing fresh attention from global fund managers looking to diversify equity investments in the coming year as worries over an AI bubble mount.
